content.description: Climb the left (south) corner of the south arm of Lincoln's Chair.  In early July this route was very dirty and had lots of spiders and loose rock.  It might be a good destination if you want to tick this feature, but don't go there for good climbing.
content.protection: Standard rack.  For the top anchor I simply slung the summit block.
content.location: As its name implies this is the main climb on the south arm of Lincoln's chair.  For the 5.4 version, keep to the left corner.  An alternate 5.5 route climbs the right corner on this same pillar.

content.description: Climb up the center of the north (climber's right) pillar on Lincoln's Chair.  This route is more pleasant and less dirty and loose than the south arm to climb.
content.protection: Standard rack.  There is not much on top for a top-rope anchor, so bring webbing for trees, if you are so inclined.
content.location: As the name suggests, this route climbs the north arm of Lincoln's Chair.  Unlike on the north arm, where you stick to the side of the pillar, with another route on the other side, pretty much everything is on here as far as I know.

content.description: Shady and secluded crag with a few easy routes.
